summary: This document is an email chain from October 21, 2020, between FBI Victim Services Division (VSD) personnel, discussing draft invitation and RSVP language for a victim and family briefing regarding the Office of Professional Responsibility's (OPR) findings on the Epstein investigation. The briefing was scheduled for November 12, 2020, at the Miami Field Office, with information to be presented to Congress afterward to prevent leaks.

events.title: DOJ Victim and Family Briefing on OPR Findings
events.description: The Department of Justice (DOJ) will conduct a victim and family briefing at the Miami Field Office regarding the Office of Professional Responsibility's (OPR) findings on the Epstein investigation. The briefing will cover the process followed by federal prosecutors in the Southern District of Florida, including victim interactions.

events.title: Email Coordination for Victim Briefing
events.description: FBI Victim Services Division personnel exchange emails to finalize draft invitation and RSVP language for the upcoming victim briefing, with a deadline for edits to be sent to the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG).

keyFacts: The Department of Justice scheduled a victim and family briefing for November 12, 2020, to discuss the Office of Professional Responsibility's (OPR) findings on the Epstein investigation.

The information presented at the victim briefing was also to be presented to Congress immediately afterward to prevent any leaks, indicating high-level oversight and concern about information control.

The FBI Victim Services Division (VSD) was consulting and supporting the DOJ-led briefing, with specific personnel (Program Manager, Victim Outreach Specialist, Victim Specialists) attending to support victims but not participate in providing the briefing.

The briefing was focused on explaining the process followed by federal prosecutors in the Southern District of Florida during the Epstein investigation, specifically regarding victim interactions, with no case updates provided.
Email correspondence shows internal FBI coordination and a tight turnaround, with invitations planned for October 22, 2020, following edits requested by 3:00 PM on October 21.
